invocation.name: Speak with Dead I
invocation.description: Allows conversation with a captured soul. The soul may initiate mental conflict. A soul may be captured during a ceremony in which the body is sacrified to Morgath. Alternatively, any gulmorvrus can be questioned in this way.

invocation.name: Heart of Darkness I
invocation.description: The cleric channels a small portion of the Shadow of Bukrai into a person. It is treated as a will attack as per entering the Shadow of Bukrai. If this ritual is performed on a dead corpse, it immediately bcomes a gulmorvrus, with a will of one. The Difficulty is 10 if the corpse has been dead less than a day, 20 if less than a week, 30 if less than a month, 40 if less than a year, and 50 if year+.

invocation.name: Necrosy I
invocation.description: Preserves a corpse at its current state of decay for a number of days equal to one fifth the invocation roll.

invocation.name: Cloak of Klyss II
invocation.description: Allows the priest, or the subject touch, to find and enter a Shadow of Bukrai safely. While within the Shadow, the subject will appear slightly translucent # bones and internal organs will be visible if not covered by clothing. This invocation is used to allow living followers attending ceremonies with Amorvrin.

invocation.name: Eyes of Klyss II
invocation.description: The priest summons a black orb about thirty centimetres in diameter. The orb contains a pair of glowing red eyes through which the priest can see. The globe can be commanded to move to any place within a range of half the invocation roll in metres, though cannot move through solid objects. It can see perfectly in darkness, badly in torch light and is blind in daylight. A physical attack against it will cancel the invocation.

invocation.name: Klyss' Command II
invocation.description: This invocation allows the priest to command one or more gulmorvrus within range. One gulmorvrus per five rolled can be commanded. The basic invocation requires verbal commands to be given, though a roll of 20+ allows telepathy to be used.

invocation.name: Throat of Klyss II
invocation.description: Any within range of this invocation are psychologically assualted by the sounds of souls loosing themselves to Morgath. Save for the priest, any within range must make an opposed will roll or flee in terror for a number of minutes equal to one fifth the invocation roll. Failure by ten or more causes the subject to faint, for an equal number of hours. Failure by twenty causes permanent insanity.

invocation.name: Myvria's Kiss II
invocation.description: This is Myvria's offer to become an Amorvrin. It is only taught to those who reach the rank of Khidarmur.

invocation.name: Resting Place II
invocation.description: Consecrates a new resting place for a morvrus. The morvrus must be present when this invocation is made.

invocation.name: Sacrifice III
invocation.description: This invocation sacrifices a subject in order to get the attention of Klyss. If the petitioner is an amorvrus, their will is increased to one tenth the invocation roll. A living priest instead has their luck increased to a similar value.
